messages.message:
Should the error above be fixed on master right now? Iâ€™m still getting errors starting license-service and job-service locally:
```        instabase/utils/db/tools imports
        instabase/utils/db/migrations/migrators imports
        instabase/utils/auth/constants: malformed module path "instabase/utils/auth": missing dot in first path element
go: updates to go.mod needed; to update it:
        go mod tidy
make: *** [runlocal] Error 1```

~I believe what was suspected to be the offending PR was reverted on master. Here is the thread: https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C05L87V014J/p1718643077718559?thread_ts=1718636231.197199&cid=C05L87V014J~
I thought that was the app tasks issue rather than our go services?
All good! It does seem like others have been having this issue as well, but I thought a fix PR for this was also merged

@Cheryl Zhou do you happen to know?
I saw you dealing with a similar issue yesterday

Oh yes to fix locally right away, you can add `instabase/utils/auth` to the required and replace section of the go.mod:
https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/58779/files and then do `make build runlocal`
I am also working on a fix PR as well
I made the mistake to only add package requirements in bazel and not in go.mods. Turned out problematic for most developers cuz we are mostly still using go.mod's for `make build runlocal`
thanks, I was able to fix using the link
i'm getting the same error in search-tsservice
